CatDescriptText: Miss Loretta Younger, 132 Trent Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "I see nothing wrong with it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Loretta Younger, wearing round earrings, blouse with bow at collar, and light colored coat, holding dark clutch and shopping bag that reads "Sitterley's", standing in front of marble wall between store windows, one with mannequin wearing bridal veil and gown
